fields.title: Effective Java
fields.author: Joshua Bloch
fields.description: The definitive guide to Java programming from the creator of the Java platform. This book brings together 90 invaluable expert rules of thumb that reflect the most mature, stable, and dependable aspects of Java programming.

fields.title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
fields.author: Robert C. Martin
fields.description: This book is packed with practical advice on everything from naming variables to writing functions, and covers principles that will help you write code that is easy to read, understand, and maintain.

fields.author: George Orwell
fields.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother. This classic explores themes of surveillance, truth, and individual freedom.

fields.title: Introduction to Algorithms
fields.author: Thomas H. Cormen
fields.description: A comprehensive introduction to the modern study of computer algorithms. It presents many algorithms and covers them in considerable depth, yet makes their design and analysis accessible to all levels of readers.

fields.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
fields.author: Harper Lee
fields.description: A gripping, heart-wrenching, and wholly remarkable tale of coming-of-age in a South poisoned by virulent prejudice. This timeless classic explores themes of racial injustice and moral growth.

fields.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
fields.author: Douglas Adams
fields.description: A humorous science fiction series that follows the adventures of Arthur Dent as he travels through space. Known for its wit, irreverence, and the answer to the ultimate question of life, the universe, and everything: 42.

fields.title: The Catcher in the Rye
fields.author: J.D. Salinger
fields.description: A controversial novel about teenage rebellion and alienation. The story follows Holden Caulfield, a disaffected teenager who leaves his prep school and spends several days wandering New York City.

fields.title: The Lean Startup
fields.author: Eric Ries
fields.description: A methodology for developing businesses and products that aims to shorten product development cycles and rapidly discover if a proposed business model is viable.

fields.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
fields.author: Yuval Noah Harari
fields.description: An exploration of how Homo sapiens came to dominate the world through three major revolutions: Cognitive, Agricultural, and Scientific. A thought-provoking look at human history and our future.

fields.title: The Da Vinci Code
fields.author: Dan Brown
fields.description: A mystery thriller that follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he investigates a murder in the Louvre Museum. The story weaves together art history, religious symbolism, and conspiracy theories.

fields.title: Python Crash Course
fields.author: Eric Matthes
fields.description: A hands-on, project-based introduction to programming in Python. Perfect for beginners who want to learn Python quickly and start building real applications.

fields.title: The Great Gatsby
fields.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
fields.description: A classic American novel set in the Jazz Age that tells the story of Jay Gatsby's pursuit of the American Dream and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

fields.title: Educated
fields.author: Tara Westover
fields.description: A memoir about education, family, and the struggle between loyalty and independence. The author recounts her journey from growing up in a survivalist family to earning a PhD from Cambridge University.

fields.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
fields.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
fields.description: The first volume of the epic fantasy trilogy following Frodo Baggins and his quest to destroy the One Ring. A tale of friendship, courage, and the battle between good and evil.

fields.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
fields.author: Daniel Kahneman
fields.description: A groundbreaking tour of the mind explaining the two systems that drive the way we think. System 1 is fast, intuitive, and emotional; System 2 is slower, more deliberative, and more logical.
